metadata.title: CVE-2021-21163 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Insufficient data validation in Reader Mode in Google Chrome on iOS priorto 89.0.4389.72 allowed a remote attacker to leak cross-origin data via acrafted HTML page and a malicious server.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21163` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '89.0.4389.82-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
